Name: Baburaj A Puthenveettil
Title: The best mixer available.
View1: Review after two weeks of daily use. I bought this mixie after being fed up with our earlier Philips (the persistent problem of blades getting decoupled from motor at loads, for two philips mixies) and Panasonic ( too noisy, leaky caps, blades getting decoupled and quite difficult to clean). In contrast, this mixie takes whatever is thrown at it nicely. It has a default dry grinder, wet grinder and chutney bowls, all in stainless steel; an extra blender bowl can also be purchased, which I did. The main difference with other mixies is its power (900w), metal couplers on the mixie base ( eventhough the coupler on the bowls are plastic), metal bases for all bowls, including for transparent plastic blender bowl, rotary speed selection switch, which can be rotated in both directions, separate push button for whipping, bowl caps that do not leak etc. Noise is not too much for the power of the mixie. I bought an extra transparent plastic blender bowl, which does an excellent job of blending everything fast. The blender bowl really pulverizes fruits and vegetables into so fine particles in no time so that little is left in the sieve when I sieve for the output to get the juices. I have tried grinding jaggery block in the dry grinder, the jaggery powder became wet due to the moisture within, and it became very tough to mix, the blades even stalled, still nothing happened to the mixie. This mixie is indeed a very powerful task master, it is for nothing that all the juice shops use this mixie. In my opinion this is the best mixie available at this price.

Title: Superb Mixer Grinder for Domestic Use
View1: I have purchased this mixer grinder just one month back. before it, I have used two other brands of mixer grinder since last 20 years in my house. But my experience with this Sujata mixer grinder is very good. In my view, this is the best mixer grinder in the Indian market for domestic use. the quality of steel and plastic is very good. Though it is 900watt motor still the noise is not too high. blades are of very good quality. The motor is very compact. most important thing is that the grinding quality is very good. I have grind 1 kg of unbroken whole turmeric within 10-15 min time with very fine powder. since the motor is in 900watt thus there is no overload protection needed and it can work continuously for more than one hour. Even dosa mix and chutney grinding are also very fine,  and also the grinding is comparatively quicker than other domestic mixer grinders because the rpm of the machine is very high. I will highly recommend this mixer grinder to everyone who wishes to purchase a good quality machine for domestic use.

Name: Wall-e
Title: Best value and star of the pack
View1:
This was our third mixer and we spent a lot of time exploring other options.
The item was pricier, going out of stock and so we went to an offline retailer for the buy.

We are a small family and grinding used to be a chore - wife uses this more frequently than Tabletop Grinder now. Small batches of Dosa and Idly batter are breeze and saves our hours spent on cleaning up the Tabletop in the WFH days. There might be small chinks with the build, but this product delivers in everything else. You won't even remember there's a mixer in your house or worry about what brand it is when something delivers functionally so well. Might look expensive at first, but you realize that this is worth it when after a year, you seem to be using it for so little time, even after plugging it in almost on a daily basis for something or the other. It probably is a tiny little noisy because of the bigger motor, but it takes so little time to do anything, that it's totally accpetable. I used to hear the complaints about the old mixer so frequently and after we bought this, i never heard a murmur about this having a problem.

Realized the variants are many, but at the heart of it, its the same motor with different jars and outer body, so pick what you need rather than worrying about what variant fits best. We bought a dynamix considering our usage which doesn't involve any juicing or mixed use for grinding idly, dosa doughs too.
I hate shopping too frequently and prefer functionality over the shine, and this worked so well, that now i try to look at most of our buys through a similar filtering criterion!

A knight in not too shiny armor is what i'd say! One of the best and Made in India too!

Added edit:
It's been more than a couple of years since brought this home. When I hear someone is looking for a new one.. i confidently recommend this. Great product.

Another year later:
The mixer is going great, we don't even move it much. It's now pretty much a fixed object in our kitchen! Thanks Sujata for this most rugged and meanest beast of a mixer!
